title: Samuel Little, Called Most Prolific Serial Killer in U.S. History, Dies at 80
sub_head: Convict was serving a life sentence in California for killings attributed to him
body:
The man authorities say was the most prolific serial killer in U.S. history, with nearly 60 confirmed victims, died Wednesday in California. He was 80.
Samuel Little, who had diabetes, heart trouble and other ailments, died at a California hospital, according to the state Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation. He was serving a life sentence for multiple counts of murder.
California corrections department spokeswoman Vicky Waters said there was no sign of foul play and his cause of death will be determined by a coroner.
A career criminal who had been in and out jail for decades, Little denied for years he had ever killed anyone.
Then, in 2018, he opened up to Texas Ranger James Holland, who had been asked to question him about a killing it turned out Little didnâ€™t commit. During about 700 hours of interviews, however, Little provided details of scores of slayings only the killer would know.
